sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Outrage among European Union leaders as the news Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny had died on Friday while imprisoned in a Russian prison colony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The death of Alexei Navalny sparked outrage and indignation in the European Union and everyone blames the same person, Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, says the Russian president fears nothing more than dissent from his own people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Roberta Mitzola, president of the European Parliament, calls him a fighter whose courage will echo through generations, stating that Russia took his freedom and his life but not his dignity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: EU President Charles Michel holds the Russian regime solely responsible for the death of the Russian dissident who fought for the values of freedom and democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Members of the European Parliament are also on the same page.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: With Navalny has died one of our last hopes, to have a relation between a democratic Russia and our Europe. And that's what we all wanted in the past. With him goes this opportunity, unfortunately. It's a very sad occasion, also for us Europeans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Alexei Navalny was given the Sakharov Prize for Freedom of Thought, the highest honour from the European Parliament in 2021, whilst he was in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His daughter Daria Navalny accepted the prize on his behalf.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of people rallied in Budapest on Friday in support of victims of child abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The protest comes following the resignation of now former Hungarian president, Katalin Novak after it was revealed she pardoned an accomplice of a child sexual abuser.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Speakers tried to avoid partisan politics to communicate with the person who assisted in this, is the biggest crime that can be committed." Speakers tried to avoid partisan politics, focusing instead on the children's cause.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's good that this protest is not so much related to a party, but rather a mass movement.

sentences.sentence: The pardon has shocked Hungarian society and opened fissures within Orban's Fidesz party which has governed the country with a constitutional majority for nearly 14 years in an unsuccessful attempt to quell public anger the government proposed a constitutional amendment that would bar pardons to those convicted of crimes against minors

sentences.sentence: Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky has signed bilateral security agreements with Germany and France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The moves are an attempt by Kyiv to secure a strong signal of Europe's long-term commitment.
